definition: first month (of either lunar or Western calendars)
surname Yuan/the Yuan or Mongol dynasty (1279-1368)
currency unit (esp. Chinese yuan)/first/original/primary/fundamental/constituent/part/era (of a reign)/meta- (prefix)/(math.) argument/variable/(Tw) (geology) eon

sentences.english: The United States inaugurates its President in January.
sentences.chinese: 美国于元月份为其总统举行就职仪式。

sentences.english: On January 4th the police charged the driver with accidental death.
sentences.chinese: 元月4日，警方以意外致人死亡罪起诉了卡车司机。

sentences.english: The agreement tooks effect as of January.
sentences.chinese: 协定自元月一日起生效。

sentences.english: The president-elect will be inaugurated in February.
sentences.chinese: 美国于元月份为其总统举行就职仪式。

sentences.english: Thank you for your letter of 20 January 2004.
sentences.chinese: 二零零四年元月二十日来函收到，不胜感激。

sentences.english: The French bouchot (suspended mussels) season is expected to wind down sometime in January.
sentences.chinese: 法国的贝类季节有望在元月份到来。

sentences.english: On a cold afternoon in January,I caught a bad cold.
sentences.chinese: 元月份的一个寒冷的下午，我患了重感冒。

sentences.english: Afterwards, I began to think of today was the first day of January this year.
sentences.chinese: 随后想到今天是元月元日。

sentences.english: Pingliang revoked in January 1964, the restoration of Pingliang County.
sentences.chinese: 一九六四年元月撤销平凉市，恢复平凉县。

sentences.english: The output of July in our factory increased by 25% compared with that of January.
sentences.chinese: 我厂七月份的产量比元月份增加百分之二十五。

sentences.english: The wage increases agreed in January are to be backdated to October last year.
sentences.chinese: 元月答应的提薪将追溯到去年10月份起算。

definition: the traditional Chinese calendar/the lunar calendar
2nd year in junior middle school/2nd day of a lunar month/2nd day of lunar New Year
11 pm-1 am (in the system of two-hour subdivisions used in former times)
beginning of spring/the lunar New Year
reign name (196-219) at the end of the Han dynasty
thirty-fifth year E11 of the 60 year cycle, e.g. 1958 or 2018
